items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah says lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against SA premier
items.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyers have threatened defamation proceedings against South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas following his public commentary about her scheduled appearance at Adelaide Writers' Week.

items.title: 'Just get rid of it': Jewish body warns against religious text 'loophole'
items.description: Representatives of the Jewish community and the Australian Human Rights Commission give submissions to a snap parliamentary hearing called to probe Labor's legislative response to the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: It is now very likely Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran
items.description: The Iranian regime has done exactly what Donald Trump warned against. Despite the information blackout, it is clear hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters have died and the US president is now likely to order a response, writes John Lyons.

items.title: At least 19 killed after crane falls on Thai passenger train
items.description: A crane used to construct an elevated high-speed railway has fallen onto a moving train travelling from Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, officials say.

items.title: Fallout of charges against Craig Silvey ripples through literary community
items.description: The fallout of the high-profile child exploitation material allegations against Craig Silvey starts to ripple through the literary community, as the renowned author faces charges of possessing and distributing illicit material.

items.title: What life was like in 2025 across the planet in a changing climate
items.description: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

items.title: Minns says Bondi bridge should be torn down, not become 'ghoulish reminder'
items.description: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons.

items.title: 'Appalling': Greens slam Tasmanian government over gun reform response
items.description: The Tasmanian government has not settled on a position on a national gun buyback scheme proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. The Tasmanian Greens say the "messaging" from the state's police minister is "appalling".

items.title: Trump dismisses concern Greenland takeover would destroy NATO alliance
items.description: Greenlandic and Danish foreign ministers will meet US Vice-President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington after the US renews threats to take control of the Arctic island.

items.title: China reports record $US1.2 trillion trade surplus despite Trump trade war
items.description: A shift away from the United States toward South-East Asia, Africa and Latin America has helped Chinese exports remain strong.

items.title: More than 220 homes now confirmed lost in Victorian bushfires
items.description: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

items.title: Sydney prayer hall linked to notorious preacher to close down
items.description: A controversial prayer hall in south-west Sydney linked to notorious Islamic preacher Wisam Haddad has announced it will permanently close.

items.title: 'She watches a lot more cricket than I do': Healy taken aback by commentary praise
items.description: After calling time on her decorated 15-year career, a spell in media commentary looks inevitable for Australian cricket star Alyssa Healy.

items.title: Rare verified footage of Iran's protests shows how they spread
items.description: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

items.title: Trump unleashes again on 'that jerk' Powell, ASX flat — as it happened
items.description: The Australian share market flattens after a Wall Street retreat from record highs while global central bank chiefs, including RBA governor Michele Bullock, issue a joint statement backing US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is under criminal investigation.

items.title: Man hoarded 'hundreds' of footballs kicked over fence, court hears
items.description: A Tasmanian man who had "had enough" after becoming the target of "pranks" by kids, had hoarded "hundreds" of footballs kicked into his yard from the neighbouring school, a court hears.

items.title: Op shops are calling for people to think before they donate
items.description: Op shops ask people to be mindful of what they donate following an influx of donations over the new year.

items.title: Lost teen rescued after 8km run turns into 50km effort in mountains
items.description: Bohdi Jackson was meant to complete an 8-kilometre run on Tuesday. After taking a wrong turn, he ended up travelling 50km, sparking a large search.

items.title: Tom Silvagni files application to appeal rape conviction
items.description: Lawyers for convicted rapist Tom Silvagni, the son of AFL great Stephen Silvagni and TV personality Jo Silvagni, have filed an application for leave to appeal.

items.title: 'Significant' theft of toxic poppies could cause death
items.description: The theft of a "significant quantity" of medicinal-grade poppies could result in a "life-threatening" situation if they are ingested in pursuit of a high, Tasmanian authorities warn.

items.title: Brisbane neurosurgeon charged over alleged medical devices kickback scheme
items.description: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

items.title: Indian truckies fed up with racist tirades over their CB radios
items.description: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

items.title: 'Victim is terrified': NRLW star facing DV, harassment charges
items.description: Maddison Studdon is accused of harassing her ex-partner as their relationship broke down, culminating in 29 calls and an alleged "throat-slitting" gesture over cheating claims.

items.title: Bernard Tomic bundled out in straight sets in Aus Open qualifiers
items.description: Bernard Tomic was brushed past by Britain's Arthur Fery in their second round match, while Olivia Gadecki was beaten by Sloane Stephens.

items.title: From celebrated cartoonist to pariah — Dilbert creator Scott Adams dead at 68
items.description: At its height, Dilbert was syndicated around the world, delighting people with its satirical take on office work before creator Scott Adams began a descent into racism and misogyny.
